text: hey <@U0B9N0HF0> per Robert’s request for a 2 sentence UCS write up, do you have anything from the Sommely paperowrk you filed that we may be able to leverage?
lemme check

Think Megan has something. I'll follow up in a second here. If not, we can always use the website copy: 
A product design and development company focused on the relationship between digital environments and the physical world
yeah i like that and i have other copy i like but looking for our most recent positioning

Uncorked Studios is a company full of insatiably curious, multifaceted designers and engineers who are transforming ideas into tangible things every day—everything from websites to walls to wearables—in Portland, Ore.
oh word.  this is what we used for Sommely?
For a recent Marce speaking engagement. TBH, I'd change (designers and engineers) to people.
i think it’s a good shorthand for our capabilities
(designers + engineers)
It's a little boxed in isn't it?

New copy from Megan :): Uncorked Studios is a product design and engineering firm located in Portland, Ore. The company is full of insatiability curious folks who are transforming ideas into tangible things every day
interesting <@U0B9N0HF0> I had opposite take, I like that it mentioned engieering and design capabilities
i worry sometimes we’re too abstracted in public image so i liked the specific copy (as Charles said, shorthand for our capabilities)
Fair point. I think you're clear to use whichever of those you like.
Doesn't sound like there is a _set_ 1-2 sentences. Just in that range.
yeah appreciate the digging and the good thoughts
Got some good progress today. Got the sensors giving me data back, also have OSC library installed ready to test for whenever we meet with DDD next.
Working on narrowing down what approach sensor to use.
And code to put everything together.
Tell me more about the 'code to put everything together' ?
Also, that's rad.
Code to interpret with a certain range we activate with and sent out using OSC.
Biggest sticking point I see right now is choosing the right sensor/mix of sensors that will give us good data to use.
I saw that the ultrasonic gave some garbage data, time of flight sensor gave weird results, maybe need to be calibrated.
Gotcha. Good stuff Miguel.
